commands.title: Commands
commands.description: A list of API functions for commands.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: To use the Swiftly Commands system you need the following code in your plugin.

register.title: Register
register.description: To register a command you need to use the following syntax

additional.cpp:
The callback has the following arguments:
```cpp
void COMMAND_FUNCTION(int playerID, const char **args, uint32_t argsCount, bool silent)
```
additional.lua:
The callback has the following arguments:
```lua
cb(playerid --[[ number ]], args --[[ table ]], argsCount --[[ number ]], silent --[[ boolean as number ]])
```

unregister.title: Unregister
unregister.description: Unregisters a registered command using Swiftly Commands.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: A list of API functions for configuration files.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: To use the Swiftly Configuration system you need the following code in your plugin.
getting-started.additional:
# Configuration Files

To use Swiftly Configuration system you need to create a `JSON` file in `addons/swiftly/configs/plugins` folder with the following schema:

#### File Name

```
MAIN_CONFIG_KEY.json
```

reload.title: Reload
reload.description: Reloads the configuration for the specified key.

fetcharraysize.title: FetchArraySize
fetcharraysize.description: Returns the array size of a config value.

additional.cpp:
:::note
 If the key is invalid or the key is not an array key, it returns 0.
:::
additional.lua:
:::note
 If the key is invalid or the key is not an array key, it returns 0.
:::

fetch.title: Fetch
fetch.description: Returns the configuration value for the specified key.

additional.cpp:
:::note
 If the key is invalid or the key is not an array key, it returns 0.
:::
additional.lua:
:::note
 If the key is invalid or the key is not an array key, it returns 0.
:::

exists.title: Exists
exists.description: Returns if the configuration key exists.

convars.title: Convars
convars.description: A list of API functions for convars.

database.title: Database
database.description: A list of API functions for database usage.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: To use the Swiftly Database system you need the following code in your plugin.

escapestring.title: Escape String
escapestring.description: Returns a safe string which can be used in MySQL Query.

additional.cpp:
:::note
 If database is not connected it will return the same value 
:::
additional.lua:
:::note
 If database is not connected it will return the same value 
:::

isconnected.title: IsConnected
isconnected.description: Returns if the database is connected or not.

query.title: Query
query.description: Returns a Database Query Result which can be used to iterate trough the return values.

additional.cpp:
:::note
 If database is not connected it will return an empty value. 
:::
additional.lua:
:::note
 If database is not connected it will return an empty value. 
:::
### Parsing table
To parse the table you need to create a for iteration for parsing each row.
```lua
events:on("OnClientConnect", function(playerid)
    local player = GetPlayer(playerid)
    if not player then return false end

    local result = db:Query(string.format("select * from users where steamid = '%.0f'", player:GetSteamID()))
    for i=1,#result do
        print(json.encode(result[i])) -- prints the row with index i
    end
    return true
end)
```

fetchfields.title: FetchFields
fetchfields.description: Returns all the fields fetched by the query.

fetchvalue.title: FetchValue
fetchvalue.description: Returns the value of the specified field.

register.title: RegisterMenu
register.description: Writes a log in log files.

additional.cpp:
:::note
 The color needs to be a hex string by the model RRGGBB.

Example: 344CEB 
:::

:::warning
 The options needs to be a pair of strings
```cpp
{
    { "option 1", "value 1"},
    {"option 2", "value 2"},
    // ...
}
```
The value can be replaced with a command from Swiftly and it's arguments, or it can be replaced with a menu id to open another menu.

The value can be also a blank string to not execute anything when it's selected. 
:::
additional.lua:
:::note
 The color needs to be a hex string by the model RRGGBB.

Example: 344CEB 
:::

:::warning
 The options needs to be a pair of strings
```lua
{
    { "option 1", "value 1"},
    {"option 2", "value 2"},
    -- ...
}
```
The value can be replaced with a command from Swiftly and it's arguments, or it can be replaced with a menu id to open another menu.

The value can be also a blank string to not execute anything when it's selected. 
:::

unregister.title: UnregisterMenu
unregister.description:
Unregistered a menu by the specified id.
:::note
 It can unregister only the menus which were created from the inside of the plugin. 
:::

getconvarfloat.description: Returns the convar value if it's a float type convar.

getconvarint.title: GetConvarInt
getconvarint.description: Returns the convar value if it's an integer type convar.

getconvarstring.title: GetConvarString
getconvarstring.description: Returns the convar value if it's a string type convar.

getconvaruint.title: GetConvarUInt
getconvaruint.description: Returns the convar value if it's an unsigned integer type convar.

timers.title: Timers
timers.description: A list of API functions for timers.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: To use the Swiftly Timers system you need the following code in your plugin.

pause.title: Pause
pause.description: To pause a timer you need to specify it's Timer ID from when it was created.

create.title: Register
create.description: To register a timer you need to create a function and specity a delay to it when you register the timer.

additional.cpp:
:::note
 The function argument also supports lambda function ( \[]\{ ... } ). 
:::

unpause.title: Unpause
unpause.description: To unpause a timer you need to specify it's Timer ID from when it was created.

delete.title: Unregister
delete.description: To unregister a timer you need to specify it's Timer ID from when it was created.

translation.title: Translation
translation.description: A list of API functions for translation files.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: To use Swiftly Translation system you need to create a `JSON` file in `translations` folder with the following schema:

content.cpp:
#### File Name
```
translation.MAIN_TRANSLATION_KEY.json
```

#### File Content
```json
{
    "key1.key2": {
        "en": "English Translation",
        "ro": "Traducere Romn"
    },
    ...
}
```
content.lua:
#### File Name
```
translation.MAIN_TRANSLATION_KEY.json
```

#### File Content
```json
{
    "key1.key2": {
        "en": "English Translation",
        "ro": "Traducere Romn"
    },
    ...
}
```

fetch.title: Fetch
fetch.description:
Returns the translation for the specified key.
:::warning
 If the translation key is non-existent for the specified language in core.json, it returns the the translation key. :::
:::note

 Key Format: MAIN_TRANSLATION_KEY.TRANSLATION_KEY

Example: test_plugin.core.started :::
